column4: im trying to install CDemu and when i do <make> it says </bin/sh: Syntax error: Bad fd number> what does this mean?
probably because CDemu is using bash specific commands, and the default interpretter in ubuntu is dash.  Edit the script, change the first line to /bin/bash instead of /bin/sh
which scrpit?
whatever script that was.  try make
all i did was type in "make" in a directory
right, try the makefile in that directory
bash: makefile: command not found
er, wait.  that's silly.  makefiles aren't bash scripts.  I don't know.  Try asking the CDemu people, they'd know.
makefile is a file, it'd be opening it in an editor, but, look for a script in that folder.
edit the makefile, it'll most likely call a script, that script is most likely it.
i have the makefile open, what am i changing?
nothing in the makefile, youre lookng for a script being called by the makefile
ok found the script, what do i changE?
the shebang (first line) is #! /bin/sh  change it to #! /bin/bash
the first line is <#!/bin/bash>
with the brackets?
good.  Well, then it's an error in the script.  You'll have to ask the CDemu people for specifics
not on freenode.  Or at least, not named "cdemu", check their website/etc
I have no idea what CDemu does ;)
correct
mountpoint in brackets?
mountpoint in brackets?
konqueror
